result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffy Chang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffy Chang

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:33 am 
INCLUDES 16CF699 AND 15CM1511. 
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke for Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, pro se. 

MOTION TO REVOKE DEOJ IN 15CM1511. 
State moves to revoke DEOJ. 
COURT grants and enters judgment on Ct. 1 (OAR). 

PLEA HEARING IN 16CF699. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (Possession of THC (2nd + Offense))>>AMEND to Possession of THC pursuant to 961.41(3g)(e). 
Ct. 2 (Operate without valid license (3rd+ within 3 years))>>D&RI. 
Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: Amended Ct. 1 (Possession of THC)>>GUILTY. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

SENTENCING IN BOTH FILES. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 16CM699: Ct. 1>>SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
In 15CM1511: Ct. 1>>$100 plus costs with 60 days to pay or payment plan. 
COURT does NOT order DNA sample/surcharge in 15CM1511. 
COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked in 16CM699. 

Adj: 11:46 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 31, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
to Revoke Deferred Entry of Judgment of Count One (stj)
Review hearing on August 5, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:47 am 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, pro se.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (OAR)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self, a factual basis, & defers entry of judgment. 

COURT ORDERS: DEOJ for 9 months with conditions as outlined in written agreement. 
Review set for August 5, 2016 at 10:45 am with Br. 3 JA. 
Bond Continues. 

Adj: 9:54 am

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:45 pm 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person, pro se. 
State notes parties have reached agreement and requests plea hearing be set at later date. 
COURT sets calendar call be set for 9/23/2015 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA to set plea hearing. 
Adj: 2:46 pm

Clerk: Kimberly 
Case Called: 11:16am
Deft appears in person, pro se

Defendent is sworn in and testifies

Court denies apptment of Counsel, dft not found indigent.

Adj: 11:17am

C: Br. 3
Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.    Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 before September 1, 2015.
